title: Ticket #1621: StatInfo::GetFileSize() for a non-existent file should return 0
description:
StatInfo::GetFileSize() returns an uninitialized value for a non-existent file. To match other StatInfo methods such as GetAccessTime(), GetModifyTime(), GetCreateTime(), and GetMode() it should return 0.

The unit test output: 
TEST:  Test that GetFileSize() returns 0 for a file that doesn't exist.
INPUT:
    Directory Path:  DoesNotExist
    File Name:  DoesNotExist
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  0
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  72296110521044
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 1195 (0.000033 seconds)
In StatInfo::init() file_size should be initialized to 0.
remarks:
2010-Sep-20 15:17:13 by psilord:
Ticket resolved since I see a viable checkin for this problem.
check_ins: 2010-Sep-02 09:50   Check-in [18917]: Set file size to be intialized to 0 in stat_info.cpp to avoid returning an uninitialized value. #1621 (By Josh Slauson )
